description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7erdb","text":"This protocol was designed to be used after the Scaled High Throughput Vacuum PhIP Protocol or the Scaled Moderate Throughput Multichannel PhIP Protocol. The immunoprecipitated phage targets are prepared for sequencing through a two PCR amplification rounds which first amplify the peptide target and second, add on UMIs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d79kq","text":"Dilute phage lysis product in water at a 1:4 ratio. Phage lysis should be used either immediately after IP or within 1 week of being stored at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":143,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efe6d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sc1p","text":"NOTE: we have done several tests and noticed that diluting the phage lysate 1:4 in water results in the most product at the end. Other dilutions ranging from 1:2 to 1:16 also worked. Using undiluted lysate also works, however there is the possibility that too much input can inhibit the PCR.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"944024F0A19A11ECAB0A9B228FC6917E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djt06","text":"Amplified samples are now uniquely labeled and are very similar in concentration and library size, so equal volume of each sample can be pooled together. If there is concern that samples are dissimilar, skip this step, bead clean, BioAnalyze and Qubit each sample individually. However, in our experience it is easier to pool first and then bead clean everything together prior to the QC check via BioAnalyzer and Qubit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17p37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vfcd","text":"If pooling, it is recommend to pool anywhere between  -  of each sample together by using a multichannel and combining all of the rows into a reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6av5e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"smim","text":"NOTE: It is also recommended to pool each plate separately from other plates. This allows us to protect individual plates from phage contamination.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"5721E000DAAC11EB9F8F45DE861CFDD9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"59AEA560DAAC11EB9F8F45DE861CFDD9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
